teaser: If Congress manages to pass the newly-reached bipartisan budget deal, it will mark something of a change. At long last, the government will have finally managed to get out of its own way and stop being a drag on the U.S. economy. One analyst calls such a turn of events "hard to believe." On the other side of the Atlantic, Denmark – yes, Denmark – is staking its claim to the sea surrounding the North Pole, raising tensions among the countries with a stake in the opening of Arctic seas to oil exploration. And finally, Samsung can put a kill switch in its phones, but carriers won’t let customers activate it.
byline: Nancy Marshall-Genzer, Steve Gardner, Sabri Ben-Achour, David Weinberg, Kai Ryssdal and Noel King
title: Marketplace for Wednesday, December 11, 2013
